definitions.definition: connected with or located on the outside of something/somebody

examples.text: the external walls of the building
The lotion is **for external use** only *(= only for the skin and must not be eaten)*.

definitions.definition: happening or coming from outside a place, an organization, your particular situation, etc.

examples.text: A combination of internal and **external factors** caused the company to close down.
Many external influences can affect your state of mind.
The information has come from reliable sources external to the government.

definitions.definition: coming from or arranged by somebody from outside a school, a university or an organization

examples.text: An external auditor will verify the accounts.
The government is committed to reducing the country's external debt.
the Minister of State for External Affairs
The country was promised military aid in the case of external threat.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from medieval Latin, from Latin exter ‘outer’.
